intro: Psychotria trujilloi, commonly known as the Trujillo's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest understories, thriving in humid tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
